View and Edit Existing Multiple Curve Groups

Multiple curves can be grouped together and viewed in a spreadsheet interface.

On the Curves tab, select Multiple Curves. Note. If a multiple curve group exists in the ODF, the Edit Multiple Curve Data Points dialog box will open. If a multiple curves group is not present, the Curve Selection dialog box will open. Here you can create a new multiple curve group.

In the Edit Multiple Curve Data Points dialog box, choose the curve group from the Selection Name. All curves in this group will display in a spreadsheet format.

Use the Index Converter to calculate the equivalent depth value in MD, TVD, TVDSS, TWT and VSEC for a specific depth without exiting the dialog box.

Use Select Curves to edit the curves included in the current group. Note. Any groups listed in open and closed brackets are groups of curves compartmentalized due to their source (i.e. the file name the curves were loaded from). Additional curves cannot be added to these groups.

Select Close to exit.

Back Forward
